title: Instruments Disconnect/Connect and Pin Numbering

body.body: When disconnecting a connector, never pull directly on the wires as this may result in cable and connector damage.
Never disconnect an ECM when the ignition switch is in the ON position as this may cause multiple fault codes to be logged in the ECM memory.
Always disconnect an ECM after disconnecting the battery negative (black) lead first.
Turn the ignition to the OFF position and wait at least 1 minute for the engine ECM to complete its power down sequence.
Damage to the connector pins may result if an attempt to fit the connectors incorrectly is made.
Instruments CM8; CR8; CS8; PB1; PJ1; PJZ; PM1; PR1; PRB; PRC; PS1; PSB; PSC; PX1; PXB; PXC; PY1; PYB; PYC
The illustration below shows the pin numbering system used in the Pinpoint Tests - Instruments.
As viewed on the mating face with the instruments (as per the illustration), pins are numbered from right to left with number one in the top right corner.

metadata.ModelsTaxonomyLink: PYB; PXB; PSB; PRB; PJZ; CS8; CR8; CM8; PYC; PXC; PSC; PRC; PY1; PX1; PS1; PR1; PM1; PJ1; PB1
